abstract.p: Mother of Iona College freshman Kevin Lawless, who died of alcohol poisoning during 1999 fraternity hazing, files $38 million suit against school and owners of Ketch 22 and now-defunct Molly's Bar in New Rochelle (S)

block.p: The mother of Kevin Lawless, an 18-year-old freshman at Iona College in New Rochelle who died of alcohol poisoning last year, is seeking up to $38 million from the school and the owners of two taverns. The suit alleges that Iona administrators and the owners of Ketch 22 North and the now-defunct Molly's Bar failed to control an atmosphere of rampant underage drinking and fraternity hazing. Mr. Lawless died Dec. 13, the final night of pledge period for Sigma Tau Omega, a fraternity banned by Iona in the 1980's for hazing and alcohol abuse. At the time of his death, he had a .34 percent blood alcohol level, more than twice the legal limit.
